titleInfo.title: USA v. Giles et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 84 Stipulation. The 2005 Dodge Magnum, VIN 2D4GZ5829H623338, registered to Lamont Giles and mentioned Count VII of the Second Superceding indictment 30 shall be sold by the US Marshal for the District of Nebraska as soon as possible and in a commercially reasonable manner. The Marshal shall structure the terms of this vehicle so any valid liens will be paid from the proceeds of the sale. The Marshal is entitled to reimburse his office for the expenses it incurred in the bringing the vehicle to sale. Any proceeds obtained from the sale of this vehicle, after payment of any valid lien and expenses incurred in conducting the sales, shall be held by the Marshal until further order of this court. The clerk shall deliver a certified copy of this Order to the United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska as to Dale Giles (1). Signed by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett on 7/27/2006. 1 cert to USM (MKR, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Giles et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that the trial, expected to last 5 weeks, is scheduled to begin 5/1/07 at 8:30 a.m. The time between 2/12/07 and 5/1/07 is excluded from the speedy trial calculation. By 2/16/07, counsel for each defendant will respond in writing to the letter of AUSA Maria Moran dated 2/8/07 indicating which of the 46 proposed stipulations the attorney will agree to sign on behalf of his or her client; and which of the 46 proposed stipulations the attorney will not agree to sign. Counsel were directed to confer immediately following the hearing regarding a mutually-agreeable date and time to view certain evidence in the custody and control of the government as to defendants Dale Giles, Charmar Brown, Evereada Kouris and Lavelle Giles. titleInfo.title: USA v. Giles et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that the trial, expected to last five weeks, is scheduled to begin onSeptember 25, 2007, at 8:30 a.m. The time between May 1, 2007, and September 25, 2007, is excluded from the speedy trial calculation pursuant to 18 U.S.C. § 3161(h)(8)(A) because the ends of justice served by such an exclusion outweigh the interest of the public and of the Defendants in a speedy trial. Specifically, the case is so unusual and complex,due to the number of Defendants, the nature of the prosecution, and the existence of novel questions of fact or law, that it is unreasonable to expect adequate preparation for pretrial proceedings or for the trial itself within the time limits established by 18 U.S.C. § 3161(c)(1) as to defendants Dale Giles, Charmar Brown, Evereada Kouris, Lavelle Giles Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp.(CJP)ORDER that the trial, expected to last five weeks, is scheduled to begin onSeptember 25, 2007, at 8:30 a.m. The time between May 1, 2007, and September 25, 2007, is excluded from the speedy trial calculation pursuant to 18 U.S.C. § 3161(h)(8)(A) because the ends of justice served by such an exclusion outweigh the interest of the public and of the Defendants in a speedy trial. titleInfo.title: USA v. Giles et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Dale Giles (1). The defendant was found guilty on counts I, II, III, IV, V, VI, VII, and VIII of the Fifth Superseding Indictment after a jury trial and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of of LIFE on Counts I and VI, which are grouped pursuant to U.S.S.G 3D1.2(c); 120 months on Counts III, V, and VIII, to be served concurrently with the life sentence for Counts I and VI; 120 months on Count II, to be served consecutively to all other counts; 300 months on Count IV, to be served consecutively to all other counts; and 300 months on Count VII, to be served consecutively to all other counts; supervised release, with special conditions, for a term of 10 years for Count I and 8 years for Count VI to be served concurrently; 2 years for each of the Counts III, V, and VIII, to be served concurrently; 3 years on Count II, to be served concurrently; 3 years on Count IV, to be served concurrently; and 3 years on Count VII, to be served concurrently; $800.00 special assessment. The Indictment, Superseding Indictment, Second Superseding Indictment, Third Superseding Indictment and Fourth Superseding Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United Statesas to this defendant only. Final order of forfeiture as to Count IX forthcoming. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM)(JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Giles et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Charmar Brown (2). The Defendant was found guilty on counts I, II, IV, VI and VII of the Fifth Superseding Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of Life on Counts I and VI of the Fifth Superseding Indictment, which are grouped pursuant to U.S.S.G 3D1.2(c); 120 months on Count II, to be served consecutively with the sentence imposed on Counts I and VI; 300 months on Count IV, to be served consecutively to all other counts; 300 months on Count VII, to be served consecutively to all other counts; upon release from imprisonment, the Defendant shall be on supervised release, with special conditions, for a term of 5 years for Count I and 4 years for Count VI to be served concurrently; 3 years for each of the Counts II, IV, and VII, to be served concurrently; $500.00 special assessment. After a verdict of guilty as to Counts I, II, IV, VI, and VII, the court finds the defendant guilty of Count IX. Final Order of Forfeiture as to Count IX forthcoming. The Indictment, Superseding Indictment, Second Superseding Indictment, Third Superseding Indictment and Fourth Superseding Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this Defendant only, as to defendant Charmar Brown. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (4 Certified copies to USM)(JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Giles et al
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE - The United States' Motion for Issuance of Preliminary Order of Forfeiture 637 is hereby sustained. Based upon Count IX of the Fifth Superseding Indictment, Count II of the Information, the guilty pleas and the jury's guilty verdicts, the United States is hereby authorized to seize the following-described properties listed in this order. The Defendants' interests in said properties are hereby forfeited to the United States for disposition in accordance with the law. The aforementioned forfeited properties are to be held by the United States in its securecustody and control. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture pursuant to 21 U.S.C. § 853(n), in which all interests will be addressed, as to Dale Giles, Charmar Brown, Evereada Kouris, and Terrance Howard. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. titleInfo.title: USA v. Giles et al
titleInfo.subTitle: AMENDED JUDGMENT for Correction of Sentence on Remand as to Charmar Brown. The Defendant was found guilty on counts I, II, IV, VI and VII of the Fifth Superseding Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of Life on Counts I and VI of the Fifth Superseding Indictment, which are grouped pursuant to U.S.S.G 3D1.2(c); 120 months on Count II, to be served consecutively with the sentence imposed on Counts I and VI; 300 months on Count IV, to be served consecutively to all other counts; upon release from imprisonment, the Defendant shall be on supervised release, with special conditions, for a term of 5 years for Count I and 4 years for Count VI to be served concurrently; 3 years for each of the Counts II, and IV, to be served concurrently; $500.00 special assessment has been paid. The Court has adjudicated that the Defendant is guilty of Count IX of the Fifth Superseding Indictment. The Indictment, Superseding Indictment, Second Superseding Indictment, Third Superseding Indictment and Fourth Superseding Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this Defendant only. The Sentence imposed on count VII of the Fifth Superseding Indictment is vacated. Final order of forfeiture as to Count IX of the Fifth Superseding Indictment filed on June 2, 2008. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (1 Certified copy to USM)(JAE)
